questions.question: Why did Old Major call the meeting of the animals?

choices.answer: To talk about his strange dream
To talk about how Mr. Jones is the best owner
To talk about hislife
He was leaving the farm and wanted to say good-bye

questions.question: What is “Beasts of England”? What does it represent for the animals?

choices.answer: A poem thatSquealer would recite; freedom from animals
An old song-Old Major mentioned at the meeting;freedom/hope
An old song thatSnowball came up with; freedom/hope
A short story that was read to the animals every night
Mr. Jones was beating the animals
Mrs. Jones was not feeding Mr. Jones and his men
Mr. Jones and his men did not feed the animals

questions.question: Why did the pigs get the job of teaching/organizing the other animals?

choices.answer: They were natural born leaders and knew tactics
They were the most intelligent and could read and write
They were the nicest of the animals on the farm

questions.question: What is the major debate between Snowball and Napoleon in chapter five?

choices.answer: Whether they should build the windmill or not
Whether they should battle again to take over the town
Whether they should work everyday or not

questions.question: What are at least four of the seven rules or commandments of Animalism?

choices.answer: No animal shall sleep in a bed or wear clothes
No animal shall kill any other animal
All animals are equal
No animal shall drink alcohol

questions.question: What did Napoleon do with Jessie's puppies?

choices.answer: Sold them to another farm
He taught them how to work on the farm
Taught them to attack and used them to scare/intimidate

questions.question: Why does Snowball want to build the windmill?

choices.answer: To cut down the work day
To use the electricity produced to help them
It will benefit all of the animals in the long run

questions.question: Why does Napoleon NOT want the windmill?

choices.answer: They will all starve if they do not harvest the fields
It is way too much work for the animals
It is too hard for them to build it being they are not tall

questions.question: At the end of Ch. 5, why does Napoleon NOW want to build the windmill?

choices.answer: It will keep the animals busy so they don't question him
It was now his idea
He was never against it;Snowball was a bad influence

questions.question: What is the name of the raven and what does he tell the animals about?

choices.answer: Mollie; Lumps of Sugar Mountain
Muriel; Sugarcandy Land
Moses; Sugarcandy Mountain

questions.question: Since the less intelligent of the animals cannot learn the commandments, what do they say?

choices.answer: "Whatever Napoleon and Snowball say"
They repeat the other animals and never remember
They say "Four legs good, two legs bad"

questions.question: Who leads the animal attack during the Battle of the Cowshed?

choices.answer: Squealer
Napoleon
Snowball
Mollie

questions.question: What happens to Mollie in chapter five?

choices.answer: She disappears
She stays in the farmhouse
She is now the leader of the animals

questions.question: What happens to Snowball at the end of Chapter five?

choices.answer: He leaves to go to another farm to rebel
He goes to neighboring farms to recruit animals
He is run out by Napoleon and the dogs
Snowball is voted out of being a leader
